document.docAuthor: Hughes, Lauren E. & Peart, Rachael A.
document.docTitle: Exampithoe taylori Hughes & Peart, 2015, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of Exampithoe from Australia and New Zealand (Ampithoidae: Amphipoda: Crustacea)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new species of Exampithoe from Australia and New Zealand (Ampithoidae: Amphipoda: Crustacea)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype : male, 11.5 mm , dissected, 4 slides, NIWA 94663 , Leigh, New Zealand , coll. R. Taylor,
16 September 2002
. Paratypes :
2 males
, AM P. 88414 , same location as holotype .

Additional material examined. NIWA 94664, 1 male , 9 mm ; NIWA 94665, 1 female , 8 mm ; NIWA 94666, 1 female , 7 mm ; NIWA 94667, 1 female , 10 mm ; NIWA 94668, 1 female , 8 mm ; NIWA 94669, 1 male , 8 mm ; NIWA 94670, 1 male , 7 mm ; AM P.92556, 11 females ,
15 males
, Nordic Cove, Leigh, New Zealand (
36 ° 17 ’ 28.76 ”S
174 ° 48 ’ 10.81 ”E
), 1–3 m , on
Dictyota kunthii
, coll. Richard Taylor,
31 Dec 2009
.
Etymology. Named for the collector, Richard Taylor.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4.
Exampithoe taylori
sp. nov. ,
holotype male, 11.5 mm, NIWA 94663, Leigh, New Zealand.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Antenna 1
shorter than antenna 2 ; peduncular article 1 longer than article 2 , length 1.1 times article 2 ; article 2 longer than article 3 , length 3 times article 3 . Mandible accessory setal row with 4 robust setae; palp 3 - articulate, apically setose and marginally setose; article 1 shorter than article 2 ; article 2 longer than article 3 ; article 3 short, subequal in length to article 1 . Labium outer plates entire, without an apical duct; mandibular lobe with straight margins, rounded apically.
Maxilla 1
palp well developed, article 2 with 6 apical robust slender setae. Maxilliped outer plate with developed row of large robust setae along medial margin.
Coxae 1– 4
as long as broad.
Gnathopod 1
subequal in size to gnathopod 2 ; coxa subequal to coxa 2 , broader than deep, anteroventral corner produced, subacute, anterior margin straight; basis longer than coxa, anterodistal lobe large and rounded, with 5 slender setae; carpus subrectangular, shorter than propodus, anterior margin with 2 robust setae; propodus narrow, subrectangular, palm extremely acute, straight.
Gnathopod 2
basis longer than coxa, distal lobe small and rounded, not reaching beyond ischium, anterodistal corner with 3 slender setae; carpus subrectangular, longer than propodus, anterior margin without setae; propodus narrow, subrectangular, palm extremely acute, palm convex, with 1 robust seta defining palm; dactylus subequal in length to palm.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 5.
Exampithoe taylori
sp. nov. ,
holotype male, 11.5 mm, NIWA 94663, Leigh, New Zealand (scales 0.1 mm).

FIGURE 6.
Exampithoe taylori
sp. nov. ,
holotype male, 11.5 mm, NIWA 94663, Leigh, New Zealand (scales 0.1 mm).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description of holotype .
Head as long as deep.
Antenna 1
shorter than antenna 2 ; peduncular article 1 longer than article 2 , length 1.1 times article 2 ; article 2 longer than article 3 , length 3 times article 3 ; article 3 shorter than article 1 , length 0.25 times article 1 ; primary flagellum with 28 articles; accessory flagellum absent.
Antenna 2
robust, distinctly stouter than antenna 1 ; peduncle article 4 subequal in length to article 5 ; flagellum longer than peduncular article 5 , with more than 14 articles (damaged). Labrum directed nearly straight down, lateral margins without midlateral notches. Mandible molar well developed, triturating, accessory setal row with 4 robust setae; palp 3 -articulate, apically setose and marginally setose; article 1 length 2.1 times width, shorter than article 2 , length 0.7 times article 2 ; article 2 length 2.4 times width, longer than article 3 , length 1.2 times article 3 , with 3 marginal setae; article 3 short, length 3 times width, subequal in length to article 1 , with 3 apical setae. Labium outer plates entire, without an apical duct; mandibular lobe with straight margins, rounded apically.
Maxilla 1
inner plate with 1 slender seta; palp well developed, article 2 with 6 apical robust setae.
Maxilla 2
inner and outer plates subequal in width; inner plate without oblique setal row. Maxilliped outer plate with developed row of large robust setae along medial margin.

Pereon.
Coxae 1– 4
as long as broad.
Gnathopod 1
subequal in size to gnathopod 2 ; coxa subequal to coxa 2 , broader than deep, anteroventral corner produced, subacute, anterior margin straight; basis longer than coxa, length 2.1 times width, anterodistal lobe large and rounded, with 5 slender setae; ischium anterior margin without lobe; merus anterodistal lobe acute, posterodistal corner rounded; carpus subrectangular, length 1.75 times width, longer than merus, shorter than propodus, length 0.8 times propodus, anterior margin with 2 robust setae; propodus narrow, subrectangular, length 2.3 times width, palm extremely acute, straight, without posterodistal shelf or defining palm corner and robust setae; dactylus inner margin serrate.
Gnathopod 2
basis longer than coxa, length 3.4 times width, anterodistal lobe anterodistal lobe small and rounded, not reaching beyond ischium, anterodistal corner with 3 slender setae; ischium anterior margin without lobe; merus margin without lobe; carpus subrectangular, longer than propodus, length 1.1 times propodus, anterior margin without setae; propodus narrow, subrectangular, length 3.5 times width, palm extremely acute, palm convex, with 1 robust seta defining palm; dactylus subequal in length to palm, tapering evenly, apically acute, inner margin crenate.

Pleon.
Epimera 1–3
posterodistal corner broadly rounded.
Uropod 1
reaching end of uropod 2 rami; peduncle with 8 robust setae, without slender setal fringe, distoventral spur absent; inner ramus subequal in length to outer ramus, with 3 marginal and 4 apical robust setae, slender setae absent; outer ramus slender, length 6 times width, with 1 marginal and 4 apical robust setae.
Uropod 2
peduncle without distolateral spur, with 3 robust setae, slender setae fringe absent; inner ramus longer than outer ramus, with 1 marginal and 4 apical robust setae, slender setae absent; outer ramus with 2 marginal and 4 apical robust setae, slender setae absent.
Uropod 3
peduncle longer than broad, length 1.5 times breadth, length 4.2 times rami, with 1 marginal and 2 apical robust setae, with distal slender setae, without marginal slender setae; rami short, as long as broad; outer ramus subequal in length to inner ramus, with 2 large recurved distal robust setae, with patch of small lateral denticles, without lateral setal fringe; outer ramus with 1 distal robust seta and distal slender setae, without lateral robust setae.
Telson
subtrapezoidal, apically truncated, with small apical cusps, with 5 pair of lateral setae, 2 pair of lateral plumose setae, without apical setae.

Remarks. The elongate, rectilinear carpus and propodus of gnathopods 1 and 2 in
E. taylori
sp. nov.
is similar to
E. burrowwo
sp. nov.
Exampithoe taylori
sp. nov.
can be separated from the latter species by the gnathopod 1 basis being much shorter and the propodus palm, which is extremely acute and without a palm defining robust seta. In
E. taylori
the mandibular palp is 3 -articulate, further separating it from
E. burrowwo ,
which has a 2 -articulate palp.
Distribution. Known only from the type locality.
